author: pintail_xyz
content:
really grateful for any thoughts/input on this article: https://medium.com/@pintail/ethereum-fee-market-reform-eip-1559-as-a-question-of-fairness-567c52dac017

It's intended partly as a reference as it's full of links to relevant papers (mostly by <@!273808422753796097>), but also just because there's an awful lot of hype around the EIP. For people trying to understand the proposal, there are now resources spread through quite a few places and it may be hard to find them buried in the noise.

The other aspect to it is the "fairness" part - the argument that at present miners are essentially extracting rent from a community resource (blockspace), and it makes much more sense to return surplus fees to Ether holders, who pay to keep the blockchain running through issuance. I don't think I've really seen people making this argument, so I thought perhaps it would add something useful to the discussion.
